Crime and Punishment

He paused on the stairs, dreading her annoying chit-chat, constant payment reminders, and complaints. Instead of dealing with that, he’d sneak down like a cat and slip out unnoticed. 🐱

But tonight, stepping into the street, his fears hit him hard.  
“I wanna do something big, but I’m scared of these little things,” he thought, smirking a bit. “Yeah, it’s true—everything’s in a guy’s hands, but he lets it go because he’s scared. What do guys fear the most? Trying something new or saying something different… that’s the real fear. But I’m rambling. Maybe I do nothing because I talk too much. Or I talk too much because I do nothing. I’ve just been lying around for days, thinking about some wild stuff. Why am I heading there now? Can I even do this? Is it for real? Nah, it’s not serious. Just a way to keep myself entertained; a little game! 🎮 Yeah, just a game.”

The heat outside was brutal. The stuffy air, the chaos, the construction, the bricks, and the dust all messed with his already frazzled nerves. The awful smell from the nearby bars—there were tons of them in this part of town—and the drunk guys he kept bumping into, even though it was a workday, made everything feel even worse. 😩

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man grapples with his fears and insecurities while navigating a suffocating urban environment.
